title: Gilani extends Independence Day greetings to nation
content:
ISLAMABAD, Aug 13 (APP):Chairman Senate Syed Yousaf Raza Gilani extended heartfelt greetings to all Pakistanis, both within the country and abroad, on the occasion of Independence Day.
In his message, Chairman Gilani said, “This day serves as a reminder of the sacrifices made by our forefathers and as an occasion to renew our commitment to the ideals of unity, faith, and discipline. As we stand at a crossroads in our history, facing numerous challenges, it is our collective resolve that will lead us forward.”
He emphasized the importance of poverty alleviation, inclusive growth, and socio-economic equality, stressing the need to ensure that the benefits of economic growth are distributed equitably so that every Pakistani has the opportunity to live a life of dignity and respect.
The Chairman called for the formulation of sound policies that promote inclusivity, foster sustainable development, and ensure that no segment of society is left behind.
Paying tribute to the armed forces and law enforcement agencies, he acknowledged their tremendous sacrifices in ensuring the safety of the nation. “By infusing unity, cohesion, and undeterred resolve within our ranks, we can not only persevere but also overcome the challenges we face.”
He also highlighted climate change as an existential threat that looms large over the nation. Referring to recent floods and extreme weather events, he noted these are stark reminders of Pakistan’s vulnerability to the impacts of climate change.
“It is crucial that we adopt sustainable practices, build climate-resilient infrastructure, and contribute to global efforts to combat this menace.”
He emphasized that national integration is the cornerstone of Pakistan’s strength. “We must work towards fostering a sense of belonging and unity among all Pakistanis. This is the only way we can build a cohesive society that is resilient to internal and external threats.”
As the nation celebrates Independence Day, Chairman Gilani urged citizens to remember that the challenges ahead are not insurmountable. “With determination and a shared vision for a better future, we can overcome these obstacles and build a Pakistan that is strong, prosperous, and just.”
“Let us pledge to work together for the betterment of our nation, ensuring that future generations can live in peace and harmony,” he concluded.
